data.title: Ben Gordon finally signs up for GB 2012 Olympic campaign
data.meta_description: The will-he-won't-he saga of whether London-born Ben Gordon will become a Great Britain player has finally been resolved after the Detroit Pistons guard finally committed to the land of his birth, having cleared it with the Pistons to make himself available for their European qualifying matches this summer.
data.text:
Gordon will join up with the strongest GB squad yet assembled for training in July ahead of a demanding summer of qualifying games in which his team need to prosper to make the Eurobasket 2011 Championships, the final staging post before London 2012.

Great Britain will find plenty to get their teeth into against Macedonia, Hungary, Ukraine and Bosnia & Herzevonia, who they have to paly on a home and away basis.

As a creative, point scoring guard, Gordon is potentially the missing link GB have been seeking to make the final step.

Blessed with talented big men like Andy Betts, Joel Freeland and Rob Archiebald, and dynamic small forwards such as Luol Deng and Pops Mensah-Bonsu, it is ringmaster like Gordon they have deserately missed.

Gordon had been pencilled in to start his GB career last summer but after a big move from the Chicago Bulls to the Pistons last summer, he felt he had to commit to a strenuous pre-season with his new club.

"I am delighted to have committed myself to GB for this summer and beyond," said Gordon.

"I have heard a lot from Luol about the team and where we are going, so I am excited about the prospect of pulling on the GB vest.

"The news of Ben's inclusion is great for the team as he will bring considerable experience to the group," he said.

"Over the last few years with the Bulls and more recently the Pistons, he has excelled in the NBA, so it's great to be able to include him in the roster.

"We have always been aware of this desire to play for the team, but unfortunately things didn't quite come together, however this year everything has worked out.

"We have a challenging summer programme ahead, so myself and the rest of the coaching team will be looking to get Ben settled in the team as quickly as possible to enable him to bring his considerable talent to the team.

"For me the inclusion of Ben is just another great example of the progress British Basketball has been making in the last few years, and I truly believe we are pulling together a very talented roster of players."

Tickets are now on sale for the home games of Game On 2010 EuroBasketQualifying Campaign, visit www.gameongb.com or call 0844 581 0738.

GB Long squad for 2010:
